newsitem.title: USA: Reading to restructure its capital.
newsitem.headline: Reading to restructure its capital.

text.p: Reading Co, Craig Corp and Citadel Holding Corp said in a joint statement on Wednesday the companies have entered into an agreement to restructure Reading's capital structure.

Craig and Citadel plans to transfer assets and cash valued at about $88 million to a Reading holding company called Reading Entertainment, giving Craig and Citadel more than 80 percent of the holding company, the companies said.
The balance of voting power will be held by current Reading stockholders, the companies said.

Reading Co will become a wholly owned unit of Reading Entertainment and each share of Reading class A common stock will be converted into a right to get one share of Reading Entertainment, the companies said. The deal is contingent upon approval of the boards of each company, the companies said.
Craig, which owns approximately 52.5 percent of Reading's capital stock, has agreed to vote its shares in favor of the transactions, the companies said.
The terms of the Exchange Agreement are substantially as contemplated by the letter of intent, as previously announced.
